passages.text: At the Widnes Police-court Peter O'Loughlin, son of
a publican in Railway-ftreet, Widnes, was charged with
being drunk and disorderly in Anne otreet East on
Saturday night ; lso with assaulting Police-constable
John Gamble, and with damaging his uniform to the
extent of 2s, 64, Ann O'Loughlin, a girl about twenty
years of age, was charged with assaulting and re@ﬀeting
Police-constable Gamble st the same time and place
Mr, Knowles, solicitor, Widnes, defended both pri-
soners, It appeared from the evidence of Police-conc
stables Gamble and Middleton, the former of whom
had his head enveloped in a surgical bandage, that on
Saturday night the male prisoner was drunk and dis
orderly in Aune-ftreet, and the constables went to him t and told him to go away, He refused, and was then told that if he did
